description: Variation of Condition 2 (Approved Plans) of Planning Permission 17/16042/FUL (Change of use of 3 floors of office accommodation (Class B1) to 3 No. 1 bedroom flats (C3)) to amend the car park layout, cycle store and refuse bin store
decision_conditions: The fee required for your planning application is £250.00.  If payment is by cheque please make payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or via the Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002.  You may also pay online via the RBK website www.kingston.gov.uk
Please provide the amount that the tree to be reduced by by percentage or in metres

On your pre application submission email it is stated that this application is a Category A1 development. Upon review of your application and supporting documentation it appears as though this is incorrect. Please see the below fee request on the basis that this is a category A development, i suspect that this is a category F development so if you wish to change this please respond to this email clarifying the category of development.

The fee required for your planning application is £10000.00.  If payment is by cheque please make payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or via the Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002.  You may also pay online via the RBK website www.kingston.gov.uk

The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission Reference 17/16042/FUL - 18 January 2018Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of waste and recycling facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The refuse and recycling facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development are either stored within these facilities or internally within the building(s) on the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material is stored or placed for collection on the public highway except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 5.17 and 7.4 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The garaging or car parking shown on the approved plans shall be provided with a hard-bound, adequately-drained, dust-free surface prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained and kept free from obstruction thereafter. It shall not be used for any purposes other than the parking of vehicles for the occupiers of and visitors to the development.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of secure cycle parking facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The cycle parking facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained for that purpose and kept free from obstruction thereafter.Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation.  These cover such works as  - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works.  Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts.  A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

Reasonable efforts have been made to check that the plans submitted for the purposes of this planning application are consistent from one to the next, and that the development hereby approved can be implemented in accordance with all of the plans submitted. Should it transpire that this is not possible and that your plans are flawed, please be clear that it may be impossible to implement this permission, and that any development undertaken which relies on this permission may be unauthorised and subject to enforcement action if expedient.

Following correspondence from the Environment Agency the scheme is considered to be inappropriate development in an area at risk of flooding and it has not been demonstrated the development would be made safe for its lifetime without increasing flood risk elsewhere.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works are adequately justified on the basis of reducing loading to upper crown following historic storm damage which has not healed well and remains susceptable to wind damage in its weakened state.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Trees can be clearly seen on Google Street View.Assessment:Appropriate repeat works to contine maintenance regime of pollarding for health and safety and for tree health reasons.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Removal has become necessary due to fungal infection and associated advanced basal decay. The tree is of a significant size and leaning heavily over a neighbouring property, its remoavl is therefore very necessary for health and safety reasons. The applicant may however seek to remove in portions leaving a standing monolith for habitat for a few years. As this is the case it is not possible to seek replacement planting which would reuire complete removal immediatly to facilitate. Additional large trees are already in situ adjacent within the same garden and will make adequate replacement for the removal, filing the gap over time. The requirement to plant a replacement is therefore removed.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Apropriate minor works with no loss to public amenity.Recommendation:No objections.
